text: Annelie Ehrhardt (née Jahns; 18 June 1950 – 22 October 2024) was a German hurdler and Olympic gold medalist. Ehrhardt was born in Ohrsleben, Saxony- Anhalt, East Germany. Ehrhardt won the gold medal in the inaugural 100 metre hurdles event at the 1972 Summer Olympics, setting a new world record, and becoming the first East German Olympic Champion in this event. She also won a silver medal at the 1971 European Championships and a gold medal at the 1974 European Championships in a new championship record of 12.66 seconds.Annelie Ehrhardt. sports-reference.com Ehrhardt died on 22 October 2024 at the age of 74. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2024 deaths Category:German hurdlers Category:Olympic gold medalists for Germany Category:Sportspeople from Saxony-Anhalt
title: Annelie Ehrhardt
